noun.description: A sheet, quantity, or thickness of material, typically one of several, covering a surface or body.
examples: bears depend on a layer of blubber to keep them warm in the water
a larger missile would provide a layer of defense at higher altitudes

noun.description: A person or thing that lays something.
A shoot fastened down to take root while attached to the parent plant.

verb.description: Arrange in a layer or layers.
examples: the current trend for layered clothes

origin: Middle English (denoting a mason): from lay + -er. The sense stratum of material covering a surface (early 17th century) may represent a respelling of an obsolete agricultural use of lair denoting quality of soil.
